description: Called the “Dear Leader” by his people, Kim Jong-il, the son of North Korea’s founder, remained an unknowable figure.
title: North Korea’s Elusive Leader
title_page: North Korea’s Elusive Leader - The New York Times
maintext:
Slide 1 of 19,
North Korea’s leader, Kim Jong-il, at a parade in September 2011. North Koreans heard about him only as their “peerless leader” and “the great successor to the revolutionary cause.” Yet he fostered what was perhaps the last personality cult in the Communist world.
